main event: A sighting of a red round object, the size of a silver dollar at arm's length, moving side to side in Odebolt, Iowa on September 6, 1956.
interesting points: The object was observed for ten minutes, moving from west to north before disappearing over the horizon., The object was described as red and moved side to side., Observations indicated the object was seen for a total duration of 45 minutes by some witnesses., The cause was considered to possibly be Arcturus., The report included several evaluations determining the object was likely astronomical.
